Description: Ostracon, fragment of the body of a red-brown pottery vessel, the fabric is relatively coarse and grey-black in section, the interior bears traces of a greenish deposit, the exterior is covered with a self-slip and bears very faint traces of at least five lines of Coptic text written in black ink.
Bibliographic references: Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (394402) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/394402)
